titleStmt.title: J. Saige Dury to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7433

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Paintsville, Pike Co Ky.
Dec. 20th '65
Hon Gov. Bramlette
Dr Sir

At the present term of the Johnson Circuit court I had to take Judgement aginst J. C. Castle & Moses & Frank Preston -- the first for Tippling Selling to minor $60 -- the second party (partners) in one case of selling to a minor & in one case of Tippling.
These sellings happend in '62 & '63 -- & the Legislature having suspended the limitation law in the county -- the court had to take notice of these acts now.

The parties above kept houses of public entertainment -- but had no license on account of there being no officers & no law in the county, to issue the same -- The armies were here some-times, & while they did not make it a business to sell, some was sold to officers & others, at different times.

They are gentlemen who are opposed to law-breaking as much as much so as any one, & are good citizens -- & I thought it my duty to make this voluntary representation of their case -- believing that under the circumstances the fine should be remitted

Petition & Statmnt
To Govr of Ky
For Frank Preston
" Moses Preston
& James. C. Castle
